a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Global infant mortality by cause for boys vs. girls, 2019
Infant mortality rates are the number of deaths of infants under one year old, measured per 100,000. This is
shown globally for different causes of death in infant boys versus girls. Causes which lie above the grey line have
higher mortality rates in boys relative to girls.

g.text: Encephalopathy due to birth asphyxia and trauma
Encephalopathy due to birth asphyxia and trauma

text.tspan: Data source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2019)
